alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 7:46PM CST until January 28 at 1:47PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Conroe affecting Montgomery County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Major flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Strane Park. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins with the river close to one third of a miles wide in the vicinity of the gage. County Road 401 is inundated and closed and the lowest homes in the flood plain are threatened. Livestock can be cut off in low lying parts of the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Thursday the stage was 25.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CST Thursday was 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 29.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning to 9.8 feet Monday evening. It will rise to 10.2 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.0 feet on 06/18/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Navidad River Strane Park 24.0 25.0 Thu 7 pm CST 29.0 26.7 12.0 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 200 PM CST.
